  • Description: During sort operations at the AFWH facility a fiberboard box was found with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained two fire extinguishers packaged with foam padding top and bottom. One of the extinguishers released its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The gauge of the extinguisher showed as empty. Consignee picked up the shipment at the location.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the floor upside down near a load door with wet marks on the corners. When placed in tote, the top side was wet as well. DescribePack: Moisture was present throughout box. The two bottles inside the inner box had small holes on the caps. One leaked due to a torn paper seal underneath the cap. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage did not spread beyond the width of the box. Once box was placed in tote lined with Hazmat bag, an absorbent pad was used to clean up the residue.

item.title: Report X-2024021587
item.description:
Report X-2024021587

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: UNIONDALE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN NASSAU, NEW YORK, SMOKE WAS OBSERVED EMITTING FROM A ONE POUND FIBERBOARD BOX. EMPLOYEES WERE EVACUATED FROM THE AREA AND THE PACKAGE WAS ISOLATED OUTSIDE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS VISIBLE ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS AN APPLIED LABEL STATING "DO NOT THROW AWAY THIS BOX. PLEASE PLACE THE CAMERA BACK IN THIS BOX AFTER REMOVING IT FROM THE WALL". "KEPLER ANALYTICS" IS ALSO INDICATED ON ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THE EVENT HAS CAUSED ONE SIDE OF THE BOX TO HAVE A BURN HOLE WITH SCORCH MARKS SURROUNDING. THERE ARE VISIBLE CHAR AND SCORTCH MARKS ON ANOTHER SIDE OF THE BOX. INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENT REVEALS SOME TYPE OF CAMERA WITH AN UNKNOWN BATTERY SOURCE THAT IS ALMOST ENTIRELY DESTROYED. PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT, THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM FT LAUDERDALE (FLL) TO LOUISVILLE (SDF) TO NEW YORK (JFK). AS REQUIRED PER 171.15 A TELEPHONE NOTICE WAS MADE TO THE NATIONAL RESPONSE CENTER (NRC). REPORT NUMBER 1392059.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: A box was unloaded from a trailer. The box was wet and had hazardous material indicators on packaging. Package handler inform management who then informed QA. box was picked up with gloves and put in hazard material drum. Contents were then inspected and it was discovered one of the jugs had been leaking from its lid. DescribePack: 1 of the jugs had a loose cap. Threads may be damaged as tightening the lid as much as possible still does not stop a small leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was quickly placed in a hazardous material bucket and moved away from workers.

item.title: Report E-2024030000
item.description:
Report E-2024030000

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-23
  • City: DANVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 23, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN3266 had a faulty valve and released approximately one hundred (100) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Indian Spill Response (ISR) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into five (5) 55-gallon drums. Crews transferred the product from the damaged 275-gallon tote into a new one 275-gallon tote. Crews cut up the damaged tote and placed the contents into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was damaged and discovered at the destination/delivery terminal. A Damaged Package Report was filed that indicates 1 x 16 oz plastic bottle leaked and was discarded. Contents were then repacked and Return To Shipper. Contents were loosely packed in FedEx Ground repack box with no packing material to keep contents from moving during shipment. The wet leaking pkg with no Hazmat markings and no orientation arrows required for pkgs containing liquids was placed in an unlined unauthorized plastic bin and taken to the HMPA. DescribePack: Loose trigger spray heads in 3 x 16 ounces plastic bottles allowed liquid to leak staining and wetting the contents leaking through a thin plastic bag and wetting the repack box as well. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Pkg was placed in a bin.

  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XDM experienced a UN2783 SmartChoice HC release from a 50-pound poly jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5 pounds of product released to a 5’ x 5’ area of the trailer floor due to a puncture. The damaged container and released product were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. All impacted PPE was containerized into a second 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED ONE GEN ROCK K300 PORTABLE POWER STATION WITH AN INTERNAL 222 WH LITHIUM ION BATTERY. THREE INIU POWER BANKS ARE ALSO INSIDE THE PACKAGE. TWO POWER BANKS ARE 74 WH AND ONE POWER BANK IS 37 WH. THERE IS AN INNER BOX WITH A UN3480 LITHIUM-ION BATTERY MARKING APPLIED. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2024030002
item.description:
Report E-2024030002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: HEATH
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3267 was damaged in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the pallet, trailer, and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE crews deployed a neutralizing solution to the impacted areas until a neutral pH was confirmed. Granular absorbents were deployed and worked in with hand tools. The undamaged cargo was repalletized for transport with the driver back to the Wilmington, OH terminal. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum, and all UN3267-impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. All generated waste was staged on-site.

  • Description: On February 23, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon drums of paint fell off of a skid and released approximately ten (10) gallons of paint to the trailer interior and underneath the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and asphalt and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drum which were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: FITCHBURG
  • State: WI

  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Veolia employee was at the customer site loading flammable liquid into the tanker truck. Once the truck was loaded, the Veolia driver communicated to the customer that the loading process was complete. While shutting down the pumping operations the customer did not follow the proper shutdown sequence and prematurely closed the internal valve on the tank the flammable liquid was pumped from. This action increased the pressure on the vapor recovery line and resulted in blowing the line off the valve of the tank truck releasing a mist of flammable liquid.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNPOP IS FULLY OBSCURED BY BARCODE. PACKAGING HAS NO "OVERPACK" OR "INNER PACKAGES COMPLY WITH PRESCRIBED SPECIFICATIONS" LABELS/MARKINGS. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN MESQ. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. Leaking, dented, torn fiberboard box (max capacity 4x1 gallon) with hazmat paperwork, and DOT Class 8 Label removed from operations and taken to HMPA. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.1 gallon of fluid from excess weight applied to package, resulting in dent and pinhole puncture to body. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-25
  • City: MUNDS PARK
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TITAN TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0825 ET Titan Transfer Inc. contacted ERTS to request assistance with cleaning a 8 gallon release of UN1210-INK- PMC031 DK GRN SDA3C. It was reported the release was coming from a vehicle impacting concrete located on I-17 Munds Park AZ USA at the Christensen Rest Area (Southbound; Mile Marker #32). At 1248 EST, Graymar arrived on site and located the release. At 1320 EST, Graymar confirmed an estimated 8 gallons of PMC031D5 Dark Green SDA3C released. No drains or waterways were impacted. Newell Technologies, confirmed the product is flammable as a liquid, but once solidified, it is non-hazardous. GrayMar used absorbents, worked it into the impact, collected and placed into one 55-gal poly drum. The contractor will transport the one drum of spent absorbents to the contractor's shop. The impacted 15 gallon pail of product was placed into an overpack and placed onto the trailer as salvage material.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 22, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum containing UN2491 was damaged in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and soda ash to remediate the ethanolamine solution-impacted trailer floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed into one (1) 95-gallon poly overpack. All waste was staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 21, 2024, five (5) 5-gallon pails of UN3265 had loose caps and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. ES wiped up the released product with Simple Green and absorbent pads. Once crews confirmed none of the containers were damaged, they restacked and repalletized all jugs of UN3265 corrosive liquid for return to the Buffalo terminal. One (1) 35-gallon drum of spent absorbent pads, PPE, and any cleanup debris and one (1) 55-gallon containing the damaged containers were taken for transport back to the Buffalo terminal.

item.title: Report E-2024020529
item.description:
Report E-2024020529

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NRM experienced a UN1760 MCT 509 release from a 55-gallon poly drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 3’ x 53’ area of the trailer floor and a 5’ x 5’ area of the concrete dock floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was placed into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents and baking soda were then deployed and worked into the impacted areas to clean and neutralize the release. All impacted absorbents, neutralizer, and PPE were then placed into a 35-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024021457
item.description:
Report X-2024021457

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-16
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat shipped as fully regulated. Leaking, torn fiberboard box transferred to HMPA staging pallet for reporting. Two additional Ecolab hazmat packages (TRK 270953931151 and TRK 270953931173) appear to be impacted by spillage from this incident; all three contain the same material. UNPOP RATING IS FULLY OBSCURED BY BARCODE. PACKAGING HAS NO "OVERPACK" OR "INNER PACKAGES COMPLY WITH PRESCRIBED SPECIFICATIONS" LABELS/MARKINGS. HAZMAT PACKAGE IS NON-COMPLIANT AND DID NOT RECEIVE A 97 (HAP FAILURE) AT ORIGIN MESQ. PLEASE NOTE THIS INCIDENT HAS BEEN ENTERED AS UNPROCESSED AT DISCOVERY FACILITY NASH. PLEASE ADVISE IF 49 CFR 178.3(a)(1) AND 49 CFR 178.503(a) AND 49 CFR 178.503(f) NO LONGER APPLY. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.6 gallon in fluid due to a puncture scarcely 0.25" in size; Caused by impact with an unknown sharp object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: SAUK VILLAGE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 22, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1755 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed neutralizing, granular absorbents to the released product and swept them in with hand tools. The other tote on the shipment was wiped down with a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads. All spent absorbents, PPE, and any cleanup debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums that were labeled appropriately and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: RETURN SERVICE PACKAGE FROM USA TO GERMANY WAS INSPECTED FOR AN INVOICE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED AN INNER BOX WITH A UN3481 LITHIUM-ION BATTERY MARKING. THERE ARE FIVE MOTO G9/LENOVO K12 CELL PHONES WITH ERT ECOA HANDHELD POWERED BY LITHIUM ION BATTERIES INSIDE THE BOX. THE PACKAGE ALSO CONTAINED ONE CLARIO TABLET POWERED BY A LITHIUM ION BATTERY. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM TENNESSEE USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 4A2199, ERT ERESEARCH TECHNOLOGY GMBH, 3 SIEBOLDSTRASSE, ESTENFELD GERMANY 97230.

DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE DIVERSY PRESOAK CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

  • City: ROMULUS

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 7ft-by-6ft area of the trailer floor and 2ft-by-5ft area of the asphalt lot and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a minor crack in the top corner of the 250-gallon poly tote. Hepaco personnel transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that prior to their arrival terminal personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and that additional granular absorbents were used by Hepaco personnel and then Hepaco gathered the spent material and placed into two (2) 55-gallon poly drums along with the shredded damaged poly tote. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found outside in a trailer laying on its side by our safety specialist Stacy Moore. Package was brought inside to the hazmat cage for inspection. During inspection it was found that the metal cap had become loose and fell off of the metal container. This caused the liquid contents to spill all throughout the plastic bag holding the metal can. Some of the contents spilled onto another hazmat, causing only the outer package to get wet. No damage was done. DescribePack: The cause of the failure was due to improper loading. The package clearly stated that this hazmat must be placed upright. This was not followed as the hazmat was found lying on its side. This caused the metal cap to come loose and liquid contents to spill throughout packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further vaper and leakage.

  • Description: On February 19, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 had faulty packaging and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the UN1263-impacted dock door floor. All impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

  • City: LENEXA

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Description: 1.X-2024021507 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER OPENED THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND PLACED IN A TOTE. THE MANAGER NOTICED THE SITUATION AND IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA QUICKLY GRABBED A TOTE WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD AND NOTICED THE LEAKING HAZMATS IN A TOTE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. ONCE THE AREA WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH NEUTRALIZER. 2. X-2024021508 SequenceEvent: WHILE THE PACKAGE HANDLER OPENED THE TRAILER, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS LEAKING AND PLACED IN A TOTE. THE MANAGER NOTICED THE SITUATION AND IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED QA OF THE SITUATION. QA QUICKLY GRABBED A TOTE WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. THEY RUSHED OVER TO THE UNLOAD AND NOTICED THE LEAKING HAZMATS IN A TOTE. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP THE AREA WITH THE FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER. ONCE THE AREA WAS SAFE, THEY BROUGHT THE PACKAGE BACK TO QA AND PLACED IN THE HAZMAT PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE WAS LOADED ON ITS SIDE AND CAUSED THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT THRU THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINED HAZMAT BAG AND CLEANED UP WITH FOLD ABSORB AND NEUTRALIZER.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-03
  • City: Tampa
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 2/3/2024, at 0230 hours, personnel in the CSXT Yoeman Yard, in Tampa, Florida, reported tank car RCRX 2714, load, hydrochloric acid, was leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Daikin America, Inc., was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-0203-00008). Hulls Environmental, a CSXT emergency response contractor, and Josh Dearing, a CSX Manager of Hazardous Materials, were dispatched to the scene. Response personnel found that 1 of 4 liquid line closure flange bolts were less than tool tight. Response personnel properly tightened the liquid line closure flange bolts and stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Scott Missildine, 256-476-8009). Additionally, response personnel verified proper securement of all other closure bolts on the tank car’s service equipment, removed hazardous residue from the exterior of the car, and applied a mild neutralizing agent to the car’s surface prior to releasing the car for transportation.

  • Description: On February 22, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails and four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel arrived and assessed the site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail. The damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021488
item.description:
Report X-2024021488

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-20
  • City: BARRINGTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021488 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT INTO TWO SALVAGE DRUMS. ONE YELLOW SALVAGE DRUM FOR THE THREE GOOD BOTTLES AND ONE SMALL WHITE SALVAGE DRUM FOR THE ONE BAD BOTTLE THAT LEAKED. APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP OF LIQUID LEAKED OUT DUE TO A LOOSE CAP ON ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES. AWAITING THE DISPOSITION FROM PGH NOW. DescribePack: ONE OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD A LOOSE CAP AND APPROXIMATELY 1 CUP LEAKED OUT FROM THE BOTTLE HAVING THAT LOOSE CAP. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN IMMEDIATELY HAVING ME COME OVER TO REPACK THE CONTENTS INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. 2. X-2024021493 SequenceEvent: DURING THE UNLOAD THE MAMAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS WET AND THE BOTTOM CLOSURE WAS COMING OFF A LITTLE BIT. MANAGER IMMEDIATELY TOOK THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. I WAS THEN CALLED OVER TO REPACK IT IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. THE TWO BROKEN AND LEAKING BOTTLES WERE PACKED SEPERATELY FROM THE TWO GOOD BOTTLES. APPROXIMATELY 2 CUPS LEAKED OUT DUE TO LOOSE CAPS FROM TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES. WAITING DISPOSITION FROM PGH. DescribePack: TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING ONE CUP TO LEAK OUT OF EACH OF THOSE TWO BOTTLES MAKING A TOTAL OF 2 CUPS OF LIQUID TO LEAK OUT FROM THE LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY. CALLING ME OVER TO REPACK THE CONTENTS INTO SALVAGE DRUMS IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

  • Description: While off-loading at the terminal, one Ieaking tote was discovered inside of the trailer. An estimated half a gallon of free product was released. The trailer was isolated pending cleanup. Environmental Restoration LLC(ERLLC) was dispatched to perform the cleanup. ERLLC arrived and inspected the Ieaking tote. ERLLC discovered a small hole in the top of the tote. ERLLC deplyoed absorbent material as needed. ERLLC transferred the product into a new tote. The waste and damaged tote were placed into a yard bag and left on the trailer for disposal.

  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that eighteen (18) ounces of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Enviroserve personnel deployed absorbent pads to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents. The damaged 55-gallon metal drum and spent absorbent pads were placed into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

  • City: MELROSE PARK

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 13, 2024, one (1) 15-gallon drum of UN1760 was punctured by a nail and released approximately one (1) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN1760-impacted dock and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged container of product was placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. Both containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE (PARTB) OF RAPICIDE WAS FOUND 1/2 WAY LEAKED OUT. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE.   • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was repacked by an unauthorized personnel. It was loaded onto a truck leaking with the orientation arrows not facing upwards and the driver did not notice till the end of his route. He returned the package back to station as needing an inspection and it was discovered during VSA. Once inspected, the truck and area was temporarily evacuated. The hazardous material was transported to the hazardous processing area in a lined hazardous tote. DescribePack: 4 bottles had either a cracked or loose closure. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QA team members were told the correct procedures of handling a damage hazmat so no further damage can occur. The driver was informed of the actions he should take when a hazardous material is leaking on their truck.

I THEN REPACKED IT IN A SMALL WHITE SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER. DescribePack: APPROXIMATELY 1/2 CUP LEAKED FROM TWO OF THE FOUR BOTTLES INSIDE THE PACKAGE. A TOTAL OF 1 CUP OF DISINFECTANT LEAKED OUT DUE TO LOOSE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IMMEDIATELY TAKING THE PACKAGE OVER TO THE HAZMAT CAGE TO SECURE IT AND VENTILATE IT PROPERLY AND THEN HAVING ME REPACK IT INTO A WHITE SALVAGE DRUM IN A TIMELY AND SAFE MANNER.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was put on the IC rollers and then it moved onto the van line belt. Package handler was not aware of the package coming up from the IC rollers which caused the package to fall from the belt onto the van line platform. The fall caused a dent in the framing where the lid was secured which caused the lid to be removed partially releasing 4 out of 5 gallons of the chemical onto the van platform and the ground bellow it. No other packages where damaged in this incident. DescribePack: Small dent on the top portion of the bucket keeping the lid from being secured further. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was delivered to QA Immediately and spill was cleaned up with dry dirt.

Inspection found the manway swing bolts less than tool tight, releasing approximately five gallons of fuel to the top of the car and to the ballasted right-of-way.
